What have been your experiences? What should I look out for. I'm not looking forward to starting all over! Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2008 11:52AM DianeB wrote: Hello Everyone: Well, after the seizures on the cytoxan I had a reaction to the taxatere. Kind of like a reaction to an allergic reaction to a bee stink. So then I was sent to ER, now my regimen is changed to CMF. Can you believe it? I am just overwhelmed. I am hoping that things start going right for a change. In addition to that, they found a blood clot in my left arm. I've had it.
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 08:23AM DianeB wrote: Just wanted to pop in and say "Good Morning" to all of you. Jenn51 - Thanks for your note from God. I'm trying to keep that part of my life strong. It is helping me get through all of this. Joan - I am sorry to hear you have additional stress on top of the bc! I will pray for strength, peace, and courage for you. I would like to reach out and help in other ways. The disadvantage of the internet, I guess. I'm glad we can help each other fight this cancer.
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2008 08:00AM DianeB wrote: Hi All: I go in for my 3rd tx tomorrow (Thurs) as well. I have my good days and bad days like all of you.  I get so depressed! It seems like such a long haul. 6 months of chemo then rads and how much longer to feel like myself? Perhaps reconstruction. Then I will be worrying about reoccurance. My life has changed forever. I know you all feel the same, but I'm just venting. I also worry because my treatment had to be changed from TC x 4 to CMF and I fear that it won't be as effective (my onco said its efficacy isn't as  high). Sure don't want to do this again! OK, that's enough. I have a sick kid home today.  Hope I don't get whatever he has!
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2008 08:13AM DianeB wrote: Hey All! I'm going in for my second treatment tomorrow. Last time I had the two seizures so please keep me in your thoughts and prayers! They will keep me in the hospital Friday and Saturday night for observation. Pretty anxious about it all. Hope all your txs are going well.
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2008 08:05AM DianeB wrote: I type this right before going to the hospital. They now want an ultrasound of my port area because I have been having some pain in that area and they want to make sure there is no clot. At 12:30 I get my 2nd infusion, so I will be at the hospital from 9:30 until the release me on Sunday. Wahoo! I will keep all of you in my thoughts as well. It is so nice to have other ladies going through this at the same time as me.

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2008 11:51AM DianeB wrote: Suz: After everything you have been through, it is only normal that you would feel depressed. I am looking at the same long road ahead of me and I get depressed too. It is something that will just never go away. Many prayers going you're way!
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2008 08:16AM DianeB wrote: I'm just checking in with all you Jan 2008 girls. My first chemo was on December 28th and I had an unusual side effect. Several hours after my first chemo treatment I had two seizures (I'm on TC x 4). Luckily, my husband was there when it happened and he rushed me to ER. While in the ER I had another one. Apparently my sodium levels dropped too low, so they kept me in the hospital for two nights. My next chemo session is January 18th and they will hospitalize me again to watch me. So, for those of you that believe in prayer send a few up on this one! I think what the worse side effects for me were the fatigue and pain. Anyone here try acupuncture? Also, I had the Emend as well and it works great.
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2008 04:56PM DianeB wrote: I'm so glad there's this site to relate to other bc ladies! Yes, the blood clot is due to the port. One more thing to deal with on a daily basis. I have to go in for daily framin (sp?) shots for a few days and then they will put me on blood thinning meds that will require going in for monitoring. The CMF starts thurs. and I am concerned about having the cytoxan in my stomach for 28 straight days so will talk to the onc about that.  Everyone else seems to be doing 12 infusions instead of 24. It seems this is a new way of doing it. The Seattle Cancer Care Alliance has been doing it this way for about a year, so I hope they know what they're doing. I'm kind of a skeptic these days. CarolC, I am also praying for your financial situation. No one needs that on top of everything else!
Posts.Title: Jan 2008--Ain't it Great? Determined1 Diana63

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2008 08:13AM DianeB wrote: Started the CMF yesterday. All went well. I started the cytoxan pills this morning. Feeling just a tad light headed. I will take that after everything else! I hope everyone else's se's were OK. I'm waiting to see what the next few days bring.
